hackathon-description-text: It’s official! Come join us at RowdyHacks as we build apps, games, and any other neat projects in 24 hours. Whether you’re a seasoned hacker or new to the hackathon community, we’ve got your back through the whole hacking experience.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Head of Enterprise Architecture & Strategy at CPS Energy
Principal Engineer at Southwest Research Institute
Research Enginee at Southwest Research Institute

hackathon-eligibility: UTSA students are eligible to come and partake in the fun!
hackathon-rules: We will be using MLH's Code of Contact:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Pictek 104 Keys Anti-ghosting Backlit Mechanical Gaming Keyboard with Blue Switch for each member of the first place team (up to four).
Echo Dot (2nd Generation) for each member of the second place team (up to four).
Raspberry Pi 3 Model B Kit for each member of the third place team (up to four).

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=North Paseo Building, 1 UTSA Circle, San Antonio, TX 78249, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How difficult was this project? Were learning curves overcome?
Is the project unique, interesting, and original?
Does this project solve a problem or impact a large amount of people?
Was significant progress made on this project? Is it complete?

hackathon-location-address: North Paseo Building, 1 UTSA Circle, San Antonio, TX 78249, USA
